docs.lead_paragraph: Archbishop Fulton J. Sheen, whose program “Life Is Worth Living” drew millions of viewers and who died in 1979, was granted the title of “venerable” by the Vatican.

headline.seo: Archbishop Fulton J. Sheen Advances Toward Sainthood
headline.main: For a 1950s TV Evangelist, a Step Toward Sainthood
headline.print_headline: With Vatican Recognition, Catholic Evangelist of 1950s TV Is Closer to Sainthood

docs.abstract: Vatican officially recognizes late Archbishop Fulton J Sheen for having heroic virtues and grants him the title 'venerable'; designation puts Sheen, who died in 1979, on his way to becoming the first male American-born saint.
